article.headline: Bucknell 68, Army 47
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Chris McNaughton was unstoppable in the paint, scoring 23 points, and Donald Brown added 15 points and nine rebounds as Bucknell routed Army 68-47 Sunday to advance to the Patriot League tournament final. The Bison (22-8), seeking their third straight trip to the NCAA tournament, pulled away in the second half of a physical game. Their trademark tough defense frustrated the Black Knights during a 14-0 second-half run. By the time Jarrell Brown sank a baseline jumper with 8:25 left to end the horrid stretch, it was way too late for Army (15-16), with Bucknell leading 57-40. It's on to Holy Cross for Bucknell, to play the Crusaders on Friday for the Patriot League tournament title and a chance to lock up an NCAA tourney bid. The top-seeded Crusaders beat American 55-53 on Sunday to advance. Brown led Army with 17 points, while Matt Bell added 13. Seniors McNaughton and Brown have been key players on the Bison's last two trips to the NCAAs, and they came up big again in their last game at Sojka Pavilion. An adoring crowd paid tribute, shouting "Thank you seniors!" to the pair and point guard Abe Badmus as the final seconds ticked away. McNaughton finished 10-of-13 shooting and also grabbed six rebounds. Brown was 5-of-7 from the field and 5-of-6 from the foul line. His performance might be most impressive given that it was just his second game back after missing a month with a broken right hand. He hardly looked bothered by the soft cast on the hand. Brown drove the lane from the top of the key for an impressive layup, and converted an offensive rebound that started the second-half spurt for Bucknell. Army looked out of sync during the stretch, getting careless with the ball and forcing shots. Not so with Bucknell. McNaughton found Griffin for an open 3, before Stephen Tyree converted a steal into a fast break dunk to put the Bison up 57-38 with about nine-plus minutes left. The orange-clad crowd yelled "March home safely!" to Army fans soon afterward.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
